# Lattice Semiconductor (LSCC) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Lattice Semiconductor Corporation is an American semiconductor company specializing in the design and manufacturing of low power field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs). Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ: LSCC) is the low power programmable leader. We solve customer problems across the network, from the Edge to the Cloud, in the growing communications, computing, industrial, automotive, and consumer markets. Our technology, long-standing relationships, and commitment to world-class support lets our customers quickly and easily unleash their innovation to create a smart, secure and connected world.

Headquartered in the Silicon Forest area of Hillsboro, Oregon, the company also has operations in San Jose, Calif., Shanghai, Manila, Penang, and Singapore. Ford Tamer is Lattice's chief executive officer. The company employs more than 1000 people worldwide as of 2023. After AMD completed the acquisition of Xilinx in February 2022, Lattice Semiconductor became the last fully independent major manufacturer of FPGAs.

The company was founded in 1983 and went public in 1989. It is traded on the Nasdaq stock exchange under the symbol LSCC. Lattice Semiconductor Corporation, together with its subsidiaries, develops and sells semiconductor, silicon-based and silicon-enabling, evaluation boards, and development hardware products in Asia, Europe, and the Americas. The company offers field programmable gate arrays (FPGA), which are regular arrays of logic that can be custom-configured by the user through software. Its products include small FPGA platforms, including Lattice Nexus and Lattice Nexus 2; Lattice Avant, a mid-range FPGA platform; general purpose FPGA, such as Lattice Avant-G, Avant-E, Avant-X, Certus, and ECP; and specialized FPGAs, which includes Lattice Mach, iCE, and CrossLink.

## 2. Current Market Data

As of Jan 10, 2026, Lattice (LSCC) is trading at a price of 84.80, with a previous close of 82.21. As of today, Lattice market cap is 11.60B. The stock has fluctuated within a day range of 82.27 to 85.67, while its 52-week range spans from 34.69 to 86.69. The average 12-month price target for Lattice is USD81.23077, with a high estimate of USD85 and a low estimate of USD74.

12 analysts recommend buying the stock, while 1 suggest selling, leading to an overall rating of Strong Buy. A market capitalization between $10 billion and $200 billion places LSCC in the large capitalization category.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

Its products include small FPGA platforms, including Lattice Nexus and Lattice Nexus 2; Lattice Avant, a mid-range FPGA platform; general purpose FPGA, such as Lattice Avant-G, Avant-E, Avant-X, Certus, and ECP; and specialized FPGAs, which includes Lattice Mach, iCE, and CrossLink. The company also provides design software that includes Lattice Radiant to deliver tools that enable predictable design convergence; Lattice Propel for creating embedded processor-based designs; develops Lattice Automate for industrial automation and robotics; Lattice mVision forlow power embedded vision; Lattice ORAN for control data security, fronthaul synchronization, and low power hardware acceleration; Lattice sensAI for Edge AI applications; Lattice Sentry for hardware security implementation; and Lattice Drive for automotive system designs and applications.

In addition, it offers Glance, an edge AI application software that allows users to control the AI and computer vision experiences for various edge applications, including client computing, industrial, and automotive applications; and sells video connectivity application specific standard products. Further, the company provides standard IP and IP core licensing, patent monetization, and IP services.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

Lattice announced plans for further expansion of its Nexus platform. Lattice launched the Lattice MachXO5™-NX TDQ family delivers unmatched security, reliability, and flexibility for Computing, Communications, Industrial, and Automotive appl[ications] as the industry's first PQC-ready FPGA.

Management's commentary suggests 2026 will be the "year of Nexus," with new SKUs expanding application footprints beyond traditional roles. By Q3 2025, these new products reached mid-teens percentage of revenue, growing double-digits year-over-year. Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ: LSCC), the low power programmable leader, today announced the latest release of the Lattice sensAI™ solution stack delivering expanded model support, enhanced AI performance, and greater deployment flexibility for a wider range of edge applications. With new purpose-built models, upgraded tools, and improved compatibility, Lattice sensAI empowers developers to achieve higher performance, lower power consumption, and faster integration of AI capabilities for Industrial, Automotive, and Consumer systems.

## 5. Growth Strategy

We solve customer problems across the network, from the Edge to the Cloud, in the growing communications, computing, industrial, automotive, and consumer markets. Lattice expects data center revenue to constitute approximately 60% of total revenue by 2026, highlighting the strategic importance of this market segment. As Lattice continues to focus on AI applications and expand its Nexus platform, the company appears well-positioned to capitalize on emerging opportunities in programmable logic solutions while navigating potential challenges in supply chain management and evolving market dynamics.

We exited Q3 with even higher confidence, demonstrated by new use cases for Lattice products across our core markets, as well as the acceleration of design wins, which are on pace for a record year in 2025. This momentum highlights our differentiated value proposition: low power, small size, fast boot time, and high reliability, and sets the foundation for rapid growth into 2026. In general, we continue to see data center investments expand across all payers and applications in the AI infrastructure tsunami.

In his most recent operating role, Tamer served as President and CEO of Inphi for over nine years, where he led the company to become the market leader for electro-optics solutions for cloud and telecom operators. Lattice Semiconductor Corporation (NASDAQ: LSCC) today announced the appointment of Dr. Ford Tamer as Chief Executive Officer and to the Company's Board of Directors, effective immediately.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

Ethan Franz, Senior Software Engineer at Teledyne FLIR, demonstrates the company's latest edge AI and vision technologies and products in Lattice Semiconductor's booth at the 2025 Embedded Vision Summit. Specifically, Franz demonstrates a state-of-the-art thermal imaging camera for automotive safety applications, designed using Lattice FPGAs. Specifically, Mercado demonstrates Holoscan camera solutions from ecosystem partner vendors Leopard Imaging and e-con Systems, designed with Lattice FPGAs for use with NVIDIA Orin AGX or IGX platforms.

Strategic partnerships, such as its collaboration with NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) for edge AI solutions leveraging the Orin platform, further solidify its market position by integrating its programmable logic into wider, high-growth ecosystems. Strategic partnerships, such as its collaboration with NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) for edge AI solutions leveraging the Orin platform, further solidify its market position by integrating its programmable logic into wider, high-growth ecosystems.

"Our collaboration with Lattice Semiconductor enables Mitsubishi Electric and Lattice to jointly develop edge AI for industrial equipment, combining FPGA-based AI acceleration with industrial know-how to create scalable, secure solutions for next-generation automation," said Naoki Nakamura, General Manager of the Numerical Control System Department, Mitsubishi Electric.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

Lattice Semiconductor Corporation reported its third-quarter earnings for 2025, meeting Wall Street expectations with an earnings per share (EPS) of $0.28 and revenue of $133.3 million. Lattice met EPS expectations with $0.28, showing a 17% year-over-year increase. Revenue reached $133.3 million, slightly surpassing forecasts.

Lattice Semiconductor demonstrated solid performance in Q3 2025, with revenue increasing by 4.9% year-over-year and 7.6% quarter-over-quarter. Lattice reported Q3 2025 revenue of $133.3 million, representing a 7.6% increase quarter-over-quarter and a 4.9% rise year-over-year. The company maintained strong profitability with a non-GAAP gross margin of 69.5% and adjusted EBITDA of 35.6%.

GAAP net income and GAAP net income margin for the third quarter of 2025 were $2.8 million and 2.1%, respectively, with adjusted EBITDA of $47.4 million, which is a 35.6% adjusted EBITDA margin for the third quarter of 2025. GAAP net cash flow from operating activities for the third quarter of 2025 was $47.0 million, which is a GAAP operating cash flow margin of 35.3%.

For the fourth quarter of 2025, Lattice expects revenues in the range of $138-$148 million. Non-GAAP gross margin is anticipated to be in the band of 68.5%-70.5%. Non-GAAP total operating expenses are projected to be in the range of $54.5-$56.5 million, with non-GAAP net income within 30-34 cents per share.

## 8. Market Shares

Advanced Micro Devices AMD and Lattice Semiconductor LSCC are major players in the FPGA (Field-Programmable Gate Array) market. AMD entered this space through its acquisition of Xilinx, while LSCC specializes in low-power FPGAs for applications like industrial automation and edge computing. Per the Mordor intelligence report, the FPGA Market size is projected to be valued at $11.14 billion in 2025. It is expected to reach $18.76 billion by 2030, at a CAGR of 10.98% during the forecast period of 2025-2030.

The field programmable gate array market remained concentrated, with AMD-Xilinx and Intel-Altera still generating the majority of revenue in 2024. Lattice Semiconductor gained traction with low-power Nexus and Avant platforms, securing record design wins in generative AI and robotics.

As shown in the following revenue breakdown by end market, Communications & Computing has emerged as Lattice's dominant segment: The Communications & Computing segment now accounts for 56% of total revenue, followed by Industrial & Automotive at 38%, and Consumer at 6%. This distribution reflects Lattice's strategic pivot toward higher-growth technology markets, particularly those leveraging AI capabilities.

## 9. Comparison to Competitors

Its chief competitors are Xilinx (a subsidiary of AMD) and Intel (former Altera business). After AMD completed the acquisition of Xilinx in February 2022, Lattice Semiconductor became the last fully independent major manufacturer of FPGAs.

Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (US), and Achronix Semiconductor Corporation (US) collectively accounting for 80–86% share of the market. Advanced Micro Devices (Xilinx) leads the market with its adaptive SoC and Versal FPGA portfolio, optimized for AI acceleration, data center workloads, and next-generation embedded systems. Lattice Semiconductor focuses on low-power, edge-optimized FPGAs targeting automotive, industrial, and security applications. Microchip Technology expands its presence with radiation-tolerant and defense-grade FPGAs for aerospace and mission-critical systems.

Gross margins of 67.9% (GAAP) and 69.5% (non-GAAP) remain best-in-class among FPGA competitors. AMD's Embedded segment grosses 52%, Intel's overall margins are 38%, and Microchip (MCHP)'s hover around 60-65%. Lattice's margin premium reflects the value of its power-efficient solutions in applications where thermal constraints limit alternatives.

## 10. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

April 2025: Intel agreed to sell 51% of Altera to Silver Lake for USD 8.75 billion, creating the largest standalone FPGA provider.

Further strengthening its position in February 2025, the company announced the successful validation of Everspin Technologies' PERSYST Magnetoresistive Random Access Memory (MRAM) for use across all of Lattice's Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGAs). This collaboration aims to enhance MRAM's suitability for mission-critical applications, including real-time sensor processing, data logging in avionics, and in-orbit reprogramming for space systems.

Lattice Semiconductor's partnership with NVIDIA, culminating in their award-winning Edge AI Solution of the Year (2025 AI Breakthrough Awards), represents a pivotal step in unlocking the potential of edge computing. This collaboration merges Lattice's energy-efficient FPGAs with NVIDIA's Holoscan platform, creating a full-stack solution that could redefine how industries from healthcare to manufacturing harness real-time data.

## 11. Recent Developments

On December 3, 2025, Lattice Semiconductor's Board of Directors approved a $250 million stock repurchase program, allowing the company to buy back its common stock without a set termination date. On December 3, 2025, Lattice Semiconductor's Board of Directors approved a $250 million stock repurchase program, allowing the company to buy back its common stock without a set termination date. This move, effective immediately, reflects Lattice's strong financial position and aims to return capital to shareholders while continuing investments in its market leadership in Small and Mid-Range FPGAs and its Companion Chip strategy.

Lattice Semiconductor Corporation (NASDAQ: LSCC) today announced the appointment of Dr. Ford Tamer as Chief Executive Officer and to the Company's Board of Directors, effective immediately. "I'm honored and excited to join Lattice at this inflection point in the company's history. Lattice has created a strong foundation, and I look forward to working alongside the talented Lattice team to drive our next phase of growth.

Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ: LSCC), the low power programmable leader, today announced its recognition as a multi-award winner at the 2025 Artificial Intelligence Excellence Awards by Business Intelligence Group. The Lattice Nexus™ 2 small FPGA platform was honored in the Hardware & Semiconductors category, and the Lattice sensAI™ solution stack in the Edge AI category.

Lattice was recognized as a 2025 Top Workplace in Southwest Washington, and a Top Workplace for Employee Appreciation and Employee Wellbeing.

## 12. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

Based on the comprehensive analysis, Lattice Semiconductor presents a compelling investment opportunity with several key strengths:

**Strengths:**
- After AMD completed the acquisition of Xilinx in February 2022, Lattice Semiconductor became the last fully independent major manufacturer of FPGAs
- Gross margins of 67.9% (GAAP) and 69.5% (non-GAAP) remain best-in-class among FPGA competitors. AMD's Embedded segment grosses 52%, Intel's overall margins are 38%, and Microchip (MCHP)'s hover around 60-65%
- The company reported strong growth in AI and post-quantum cryptography applications. Lastly, we estimate the percentage of AI usage across our products will be in the high teens in 2025 and mid-20% range in 2026
- Lattice expects data center revenue to constitute approximately 60% of total revenue by 2026
- Strong financial position with The company's debt-free balance sheet and $350 million undrawn revolving credit facility provide strategic flexibility

**Risk Factors:**
- Potential concerns, however, include the company's current valuation, which trades at a significant premium (P/E ratios ranging from 299.64 to 353.38 as of late 2025), suggesting that much of its future growth potential may already be factored into the stock price. Sustained growth and a doubling in value would therefore depend on consistent execution, exceeding current analyst expectations, and a continued favorable market environment
- Market concentration risk as collectively accounting for 80–86% share of the market among top players
- Cyclical nature of semiconductor industry

**Investment Rating: 8/10**

Based on the company's strong positioning in the growing AI infrastructure market, best-in-class margins, strategic partnerships with NVIDIA and other key players, and strong financial fundamentals, I assign Lattice Semiconductor a "Strong Buy" rating of 8 out of 10.

**Estimated Fair Value:** $90-95

Given the company's expected growth trajectory with data center revenue to constitute approximately 60% of total revenue by 2026, AI usage across our products will be in the high teens in 2025 and mid-20% range in 2026, and the current analyst price target range of $74-$85, I estimate a fair value range of $90-95 for investors with a growth focus and moderate risk appetite. This represents approximately 6-12% upside from current levels, factoring in the company's unique market position as the last independent FPGA leader and its strong positioning in the AI infrastructure boom.
tldr_summary:
Lattice Semiconductor is an independent semiconductor company specializing in low-power field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs) for edge computing, AI, and industrial applications across communications, computing, and automotive markets.

The company is strategically positioned as the last fully independent FPGA manufacturer, with a strong focus on AI and emerging technologies. Its Nexus platform and sensAI solutions are driving growth, targeting data center markets expected to reach 60% of revenue by 2026. Key strategic partnerships with NVIDIA and Mitsubishi Electric enhance its market positioning. Lattice maintains industry-leading gross margins (69.5%), consistently secures record design wins, and has demonstrated robust financial performance with increasing revenue in AI and edge computing segments.

With a strong market outlook, strategic technology focus, and expanding AI capabilities, Lattice receives an 8/10 "Strong Buy" rating, with an estimated fair value of $90-95, representing 6-12% potential upside.
